creator: taras.tielkes@gmail.com
text:
A .tld file, bound to namespace "http://test" defines an EL function.
The same .tld file also defines a tagfile in tagx format.

When the tagfile imports it's own namespace, and calls an EL function from it's
own tag library, a StackOverflowError will occur when the taglib is loaded
(usually when the first jsp/jspx importing the taglib is parsed.

tld file
----------
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>
<taglib xmlns="http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/j2ee"
        xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
        xsi:schemaLocation="http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/j2ee
http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/j2ee/web-jsptaglibrary_2_0.xsd"
        version="2.0">

  <tlib-version>1.0</tlib-version>
  <short-name>test</short-name>
  <uri>http://test</uri>

  <tag-file>
    <name>test</name>
    <path>/WEB-INF/tags/test/test.tagx</path>
  </tag-file>

  <function>
    <name>foo</name>
    <function-class>test.Functions</function-class>
    <function-signature>boolean foo()</function-signature>
  </function>

</taglib>
----------

tagx file
----------
<jsp:root xmlns:jsp="http://java.sun.com/JSP/Page"
          xmlns:test="http://test"
          version="2.0">
  ${test:foo()}
</jsp:root>
----------

jspx file
----------
<jsp:root xmlns:jsp="http://java.sun.com/JSP/Page"
          xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"
          xmlns:test="http://test" version="2.0">
  <html>
    <body>
      <test:test/>
    </body>
  </html>
</jsp:root>
----------

Isn't Jasper part of Tomcat?
If so, the bug is located there, in the dependency resolving part.

What part of Sun code would you think is in error here?
creator: taras.tielkes@gmail.com

text:
This not only applies to XML tagfiles calling EL functions from the the TLD, but
also to XML tagfiles importing other tags from the same TLD(!).

This basically breaks usage of XML tagfiles in tomcat, when used in a scenario
of real-world complexity.
